thread.title: Man Accused Of Planning To Blow Up Target Stores For Cheaper Stock
thread.title_full: Man Accused Of Planning To Blow Up Target Stores For Cheaper Stock

author: CBS Miami
title: Man Accused Of Planning To Blow Up Target Stores For Cheaper Stock
text:
Man Accused Of Planning To Blow Up Target Stores For Cheaper Stock February 17, 2017 9:16 AM Filed Under: Bomb Plot , Florida , Target MIAMI, FL - DECEMBER 19: A Target store is seen on December 19, 2013 in Miami, Florida. Target announced that about 40 million credit and debit card accounts of customers who made purchases by swiping their cards at terminals in its U.S. stores between November 27 and December 15 may have been stolen. (Photo by Joe Raedle/Getty Images) 
Follow CBSMIAMI.COM: Facebook | Twitter 
OCALA (CBSMiami/AP) — A Florida man is accused of planning to blow up Target stores along the East Coast in order to get cheap stock if the company’s stock value plunged after the explosions. 
The U.S Attorney’s Office in the middle district of Florida said in a news release on Thursday that 48-year-old Mark Charles Barnett is charged with possession of a firearm affecting commerce by a previously convicted felon. Barnett is a registered sex offender in Florida. 
If convicted, Barnett faces up to 10 years in prison. Jail records don’t say whether he’s hired a lawyer. 
An affidavit says Barnett offered to pay another man $10,000 to place at least 10 “improvised explosive bombs” disguised in food-item packaging in stores from New York to Florida. The man went to authorities.
